str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be slow, I delay, tarry. From bradus; to delay.

parse: Verb - Perfect Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ana and strepho; to overturn; also to return; by implication, to busy oneself, i.e. Remain, live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A pillar, support, column. From stuo; a post, i.e. support.
And, even, also, namely.
A foundation, stay, support. From a derivative of hedraios; a support, i.e. basis.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From alethes; truth.
